textname: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

textname: You can observe a lot just by watching.
author: Yogi Berra

textname: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
author: Abraham Lincoln

textname: Difficulties increase the nearer we get to the goal.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

textname: Fate is in your hands and no one elses
author: Byron Pulsifer

textname: Be the chief but never the lord.
author: Lao Tzu

textname: Nothing happens unless first we dream.
author: Carl Sandburg

textname: Well begun is half done.
author: Aristotle

textname: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.
author: Yogi Berra

textname: Self-complacency is fatal to progress.
author: Margaret Sangster

textname: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

textname: What you give is what you get.
author: Byron Pulsifer

textname: We can only learn to love by loving.
author: Iris Murdoch

textname: Life is change. Growth is optional. Choose wisely.
author: Karen Clark

textname: You'll see it when you believe it.
author: Wayne Dyer

textname: Today is the tomorrow we worried about yesterday.
It's easier to see the mistakes on someone else's paper.

text: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.

textname: To lead people walk behind them.
author: Lao Tzu

textname: Having nothing, nothing can he lose.
author: William Shakespeare

textname: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

textname: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
author: Publilius Syrus

textname: Ideas are the beginning points of all fortunes.
author: Napoleon Hill

textname: Everything in life is luck.
author: Donald Trump

textname: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
author: Lao Tzu

textname: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
author: Benjamin Spock

textname: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
author: Confucius

textname: The day is already blessed, find peace within it.
From error to error one discovers the entire truth.
author: Sigmund Freud

textname: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

textname: Bite off more than you can chew, then chew it.
author: Ella Williams

textname: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
author: Buddha

textname: One today is worth two tomorrows.
author: Benjamin Franklin

textname: Once you choose hope, anythings possible.
author: Christopher Reeve

textname: God always takes the simplest way.
author: Albert Einstein

textname: One fails forward toward success.
author: Charles Kettering

textname: From small beginnings come great things.
Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere
author: Chinese proverb

textname: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

textname: The world is always in movement.
author: V. Naipaul

textname: Never mistake activity for achievement.
author: John Wooden

textname: What worries you masters you.
author: Haddon Robinson

textname: One faces the future with ones past.
author: Pearl Buck

text: Goals are the fuel in the furnace of achievement.
author: Brian Tracy

textname: Who sows virtue reaps honour.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

textname: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
author: Dalai Lama

textname: Talk doesn't cook rice.
author: Chinese proverb

textname: He is able who thinks he is able.
author: Buddha

textname: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
author: Larry Elder

textname: To succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Michael Korda

textname: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
author: Albert Einstein

textname: A weed is no more than a flower in disguise.
author: James Lowell

textname: Do, or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

textname: All serious daring starts from within.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
